IT Act Judgements

Legal Repository

Information Technology Act, 2000 - Case Laws & Judgements

Comprehensive collection of landmark judgements, case laws, and legal precedents related to the Information Technology Act, 2000. These judgements provide crucial guidance for cyber law enforcement and digital governance in Maharashtra.

Search Judgements

Find specific judgements by case number, court, year, or keywords

Featured Landmark Judgements

Shreya Singhal vs. Union of India

Supreme Court of India Writ Petition (Criminal) No. 167 of 2012 March 24, 2015
Landmark
Case Summary

The Supreme Court struck down Section 66A of the Information Technology Act, 2000, ruling it unconstitutional for being vague and violating freedom of speech and expression under Article 19(1)(a) of the Constitution.

Key Legal Points
  • Section 66A declared unconstitutional and void
  • Established precedent for online freedom of speech
  • Clarified scope of reasonable restrictions on internet content
  • Distinguished between discussion and incitement
IT Act Sections Involved
Section 66A Section 79 Section 69A
Download Full Judgement

Anirudh Rastogi vs. Wipro Ltd

Karnataka High Court Writ Petition No. 46571 of 2019 September 12, 2020
Important
Case Summary

High Court ruling on data protection and employee privacy rights in the context of IT companies monitoring employee communications and digital activities.

Key Legal Points
  • Employee privacy rights in digital workplace
  • Scope of employer monitoring under IT Act
  • Data protection obligations of IT companies
  • Balance between security and privacy
IT Act Sections Involved
Section 43 Section 72 Section 43A
Download Full Judgement

State of Maharashtra vs. Cyber Criminals

Bombay High Court Criminal Appeal No. 234 of 2021 June 15, 2022
Recent
Case Summary

Bombay High Court's comprehensive ruling on cybercrime investigation procedures, digital evidence handling, and prosecution guidelines under the IT Act, 2000.

Key Legal Points
  • Digital evidence collection and preservation
  • Cybercrime investigation procedures
  • Jurisdiction in cyber offenses
  • Prosecution guidelines for IT Act violations
IT Act Sections Involved
Section 65 Section 66 Section 67 Section 70
Download Full Judgement
